Belgium (Article 50), judgment of 10 March 1972, Series A no. 14, pp. 7-9, §§ 15-16;Decision on the Competence of the Court to give an Advisory Opinion [GC] (dec.), 2 June 2004, ECHR 2004-VI;Golder v. the United Kingdom, judgment of 21 February 1975, Series A no. 18, p. 16, § 34;Lorsé and Others v. the Netherlands, no. 52750/99, §§ 37-40, 4 February 2003;Nilsen and Johnsen v. Norway [GC], no. 23118/93, § 62, ECHR 1999-VIII;Reilly v. the United Kingdom (dec.), no. 53731/00, 26 June 2003;Scordino v. Italy (no. 1) [GC], no. 36813/97, §§ 176, 233, 234, ECHR 2006-...;Selmouni v. France ([GC], no. 25803/94, §§ 74-77, ECHR 1999-V;Van der Ven v. the Netherlands, no. 50901/99, ECHR 2003-II;Van Mechelen and Others v. the Netherlands, judgment of 23 April 1997, Reports of Judgments and decisions 1997-III, §§ 30-36
conclusion: Violation of Art. 3;Not necessary to examine Art. 8;Just satisfaction reserved
externalsources: Report to the Netherlands Government on the visits to the Netherlands carried out by the European Committee for the Prevention of Torture and Inhuman and Degrading Treatment or Punishment (CPT) in 1997 and 2002 (CPT/Inf (98) 15 and (2002) 30)
